The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include a new chapter focusing on providing assistance for the Caribbean region to promote economic development, small economy diversification, technical training, trade enhancement, judicial reform, and environmental management. The purpose of this chapter is to assist the countries of the Caribbean region in achieving sustainable economic development through various activities such as small economy diversification, technical training, trade enhancement, judicial reform, and environmental management. The President, through the Administrator of the United States Agency for International Development, is authorized to establish and implement a program to support these economic and development activities in the region.
